full_text: FREE KNITTING PATTERN DOWNLOADABLE PDF The Coco sleeveless cardigan is a quick and easy project to knit. It is worked from top to bottom with wide armholes. It can be worn over a blouse or t-shirt, in mid-season or in winter. It’s a model that’s easy to wear and change. The pattern is particularly detailed in order to provide precise instructions for knitting beginners. A step-by-step video accompanies the sheet to help you get started. LEVEL: beginner This is a digital pattern, accompanied by a step-by-step video. SIZES: XS – S – M – L – XL Chest measurement of finished garment approximately 108 – 112 – 116 – 120 – 128cm. It is recommended to wear it with a positive ease of 15 to 20 cm depending on the desired effect. It is presented in size L with 20cm of positive ease. SAMPLE: 13 m x 16 rows for 10 x 10 cm in stockinette stitch with 7mm needles. WOOL: the sweater is knitted with a yarn: Kid mohair from La pharmacie (Approximately 450 – 480 – 500 – 550 – 600) or Brushed Alpaca Silk from DropsDesign in double (approximately 900 – 960 – 1000 – 1100 – 1200m) or Ombelle from Fonty in double (approximately 900 – 960 – 1000 – 1100 – 1200m) Other wool equivalents are available in the tutorial as well as in the step-by-step video. MATERIAL: – Suggested needles n°6mm (collar and armholes) and n°7mm (body), – 1 Cable 40cm (body and armholes) and 80cm (body) – 1 Wool needle – 1 cable or piece of wool to put the stitches on hold – 2 marker rings – 1 pair of small scissors – 1 tape measure 4 20mm buttons TECHNIQUES Top-down construction (from top to bottom) Stockinette stitch Circular needles Increases between layers Classic cast-on Picking up stitches Elastic cast-off 1/1 ribbing Buttonholes NOTES: The explanations of the pattern are given in number of rows and in cm. Depending on the wool you choose, choose the size in cm so as not to have any surprises. Share with #cocomarieknit #cocomarieknitpattern #cocovest
